Package com.lopl.melody.settings

Class GuildSettings

java.lang.Object
com.lopl.melody.settings.GuildSettings
public class GuildSettings
extends java.lang.Object
This class is the holder of every different Setting. Every instance belongs to a specific Guild. You can retrieve a GuildSettings object with:

Example: 

 GuildSettings guildSettings = SettingsManager.settingsOf(guild);

    • GuildSettings

      GuildSettings​(net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Guild guild)

  • Method Details

    • register

      public <T> void register​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass, Setting<?> setting)
      This method will put a Settings object or subclass into the settings map.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the specific setting subclass generic
      Parameters:
      tClass - the class holding the setting
      setting - the setting itself

    • getSetting

      public <T extends Setting<?>> T getSetting​(java.lang.Class<T> tClass)
      This will return the Setting object of the specified Setting class
      Type Parameters:
      T - the generic of the wanted object
      Parameters:
      tClass - the class of the wanted object
      Returns:
      the wanted object

    • getUnknownSetting

      public Setting<SettingValue> getUnknownSetting​(java.lang.Class<?> tClass)
      This will return the Setting object of the specified Setting class. The class doesn't has to be a specific Setting subclass to support classes instantiated from a classes String name.
      Parameters:
      tClass - the class of the wanted object
      Returns:
      the wanted object

    • getSettings

      public java.util.List<Setting<?>> getSettings()
      This will act like a getter to return all registered settings
      Returns:
      all settings

    • notifyDatasetChanged

      public void notifyDatasetChanged()
      Calling this method will trigger the SettingSaver to save this object to the database.
